page.title: 13DONCASTER PLANT WORKS
page.content: THE PLANT WORKS EMPLOY APPROXIMATELY THREE THOUSAND BRITISH RAIL ENGINEERS. TEN YEARS AGO THEY EMPLOYED THREE THOUSAND FIVE HUNDRED ENGINEERS.THEY REPAIR VEHICLES,LOCOMOTIVES,DIESEL AND SHUNTERS AS WELL AS DMU'S.(DIESEL MULTIPLE UNITS ) IN ADDITION TO THE REPAIRS FIFTY NEW LOCOMOTIVES ARE BEING MADE.SO FAR THEY HAVE BUILT THIRTY AND THEY STILL HAVE TWENTY TO GO. IN THE LAST TEN YEARS THE TRAINS HAVE NOT VARIED MUCH BUT NOWADAYS THEY BUILD MORE WAGONS.THE NEW DIESEL LOCOMOTIVE WEIGHS 120 TONS.IT TRAVELS OVER 80 M.P.H. AND IS MAINLY USED FOR CARRYING FREIGHT FROM ONE PLACE TO ANOTHER. THE PLANT ITSELF IS INDUSTRIAL AND IT NEEDS A VARIETY OF PEOPLE TO WORK THERE SUCH AS LABOURERS,PAINTERS, FITTERS (CRIMY BOLIE BAY) AND BOGIES.
